Key Arguments: The proposed legislation will exacerbate harms already experienced by COVID-19 vaccine-injured Australians due to existing misinformation policies.
Current censorship practices have prevented vaccine-injured individuals from accessing necessary medical information, treatment, and support.
Definitions of misinformation are arbitrary and have led to the suppression of valid scientific research and personal stories.
The legislation will increase vulnerability and harm to vaccine-injured Australians rather than protect them.
Government and social media censorship have stifled public debate and scientific research on vaccine injuries.
Main Themes: COVID-19 vaccine injuries and lack of support
Government and social media roles in information suppression
Notable Quotes: The increase of, and normalisation of these powers, and the provision of additional reserve powers, will not protect vaccine-injured Australians from harm, as the bill is intended. It will instead increase our vulnerability and harm our health, which is in direct contradiction to the purpose of the bill.
Definitions of misinformation, no matter how well they may be formulated, will never be able to avoid serious collateral damage to the community.
Censorship of all messaging other than official Government claims of vaccine safety is directly responsible for many peopleâ€™s decision to get vaccinated.
